bibl.title: The Institutional Models for Ptolemaic Royal Banks and Granaries
bibl.note: Introduction. - The case for Greek models. - The case for Egyptian models: distributed networks. - The case for Egyptian models: transfer accounting systems. - Orders for outpayment. - Receipts for outpayment. - Διαγραφαί or orders to accept inpayment. - Running or daybook accounts. - Summary and balanced accounts. - Conclusions.
bibl.seg: Brian Muhs, The Institutional Models for Ptolemaic Royal Banks and Granaries.

Introduction. - The case for Greek models. - The case for Egyptian models: distributed networks. - The case for Egyptian models: transfer accounting systems. - Orders for outpayment. - Receipts for outpayment. - Διαγραφαί or orders to accept inpayment. - Running or daybook accounts. - Summary and balanced accounts. - Conclusions.
